Recipe.title: Jigglers
Recipe.Source: From the back of a box of Jello
Recipe.Description: There was a time when Jello Jigglers were included in commercials. Even though we haven't seen such a commercial in a long time, kids still love them!

Ingredients.section: <ingredient name="Flavored Gelatin" nameNote="Such as Jello" amount="2 Packages" amountNote="0.6-oz. />

section.instruction: Put Gelatin into a small mixing bowl.
Carefully, pour Boiling Water into the small mixing bowl.
Stir until Gelatin is completely dissolved.

Pour mixture into 9&inch; &by; 13&inch; pan.
Hint: If you lightly spray the pan with non-stick spray (such as Pam) then the treats are easier to remove when done.
After Jigglers have set, cut them into 1&inch; &by; 2&inch; rectangles with a knife.
Remove from the pan and enjoy!

Notes.note:
In Step 3, if you add the powder directly into the Boiling Water, it may " flash boil".
This will cause it to spray all over and somebody usually gets burned.
(Believe me, I learned the hard way!)

Modifications.modification: Instead of cutting Jigglers into rectangles, use cookie cutters to cut into decorative shapes.

To make the treats more nutritious (and better tasting):
Use some sort of fruit Juice instead of water.

ol.li: When Gelatin is completely disolved, add 1½ Cups Ice Water.
Stir until ice is completely melted before pouring into pan.

Recipe.FinalNote: A similar recipe for Diabetics is Desserts and Snacks: Sugar-Free Gummy Treats
